title: How to get myself to start (and keep going) with learning things, even though I am not enjoying the learning process (which, right now, involves reading books on the subjects) - Quora

response.answer_text: What are you "learning"? Or are you swotting? Curiosity is the key, for me. Is it possible that you can find a way to look at it as a mystery you must solve? The more you ply your mind with how you hate the process, the less progress you will make.what is the ultimate goal? Resentment will derail your best efforts. Good luck-take a deep breath, put the book down, and reflect. You can do it.

It feels like you're studying things you don't really want to learn or that you're not interested in. Change that. You're never going to learn everything anyway. Spend your life learning about things that interest you. It won't be a chore then. It will be like a treasure hunt.
Make a project for yourself. The project will no doubt require relevant skills and you will be forced to acquire such skills, but with a sense of purpose.
